name: happy-coder
description: Mobile and Web client for Claude Code and Codex
author: Kirill Dubovitskiy

scripts.help:
echo '
Happy CLI - Available Scripts
==============================

Development:
  dev                      Run in development mode with tsx
  dev:local-server         Run with local server (.env.dev-local-server)
  dev:integration-test-env Run with integration test env

Build & Test:
  build                    Compile TypeScript and bundle with pkgroll
  typecheck                Type-check without emitting files
  test                     Build and run all tests
  start                    Build and run the CLI

Mutation Testing (Stryker):
  mutate                   Full mutation test run with reports
  mutate:incremental       Fast incremental run (recommended)
  mutate:dry-run           Verify setup without running mutations
  mutate:report            Open HTML report in browser
  Note: See reports/mutation/html/ for results

Release:
  prepublishOnly           Pre-publish validation (build + test)
  release                  Create a new release with release-it

Note: Build runs before tests because daemon commands execute the binary directly.
'
scripts.why do we need to build before running t: We need the binary to be built so we run daemon commands which directly run the binary - we don't want them to go out of sync or have custom spawn logic depending how we started happy
scripts.build: rm -rf dist && npx tsc --noEmit && pkgroll && node scripts/fix-mcp-imports.js
scripts.test: yarn build && NODE_OPTIONS='--no-deprecation' npx vitest run
scripts.mutate:report: open reports/mutation/html/index.html || xdg-open reports/mutation/html/index.html 2>/dev/null || echo 'Open reports/mutation/html/index.html in your browser'
